TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DownloadProgressChangedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a console application, since events are assigned to threads out of a thread pool, you might receive update progress events out of order, with a subsequent event showing a decrease compared to a previous event. You will not see such behavior in a Windows Forms application, because events in Windows Forms are processed sequentially out of the UI thread's message queue.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of DownloadProgressChangedEventArgs in the context of an application that uses <xref:System.Deployment.Application.InPlaceHostingManager> to download and install a ClickOnce application programmatically.
[!code-vb[System.Deployment.Application.InPlaceHostingManager#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/InPlaceHostingManagerProjectVB/Form1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[System.Deployment.Application.InPlaceHostingManager#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/InPlaceHostingManagerProject/Form1.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of bytes downloaded to the local computer.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int64> representing the number of downloaded bytes.

Docs.summary: Gets the progress state of the download.
Docs.value: A value describing which portion of the ClickOnce application is being downloaded.

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of bytes for the download operation.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int64> representing the total size of the download, in bytes.
